page.title: 19Smith's Green Farm.
page.content: The farmhouse was built in the{17th {century}of lathe and plaster, altered in Georgian times and added to in the 1950s. At{Smiths Green {Farm,}they've got 75 sows, including gilts, 5 boars and 600 piglets. The boars are all named. 4 of them are Landrace, 1 large white. The gilts have their first litter at 10 months. A gilt has 7-8 litters. The piglets stay with the sow for 3-4 weeks. They are sold at 17 weeks weighing about 60 kilograms to a slaughter house in Chelmsford. The red brick farmworkers' cottages were made from locally made bricks. {The kiln}was still in use until 1889. Outside the village are two bungalows, originally farmworkers cottages. Midway between the two is a{small brick bakehouse,}with the original oven inside, and a{well}which was still in use until 40 years ago.
